title: I need your thoughts
content:
What up cousins. I am in need of your great opinions, I have a freelance graphic design studio based in Los Angeles, CA. I want to update my logo, but I'm stuck in choosing a type that will suit our icon. the type we were using before is in the Myriad family, but now it looks a bit soft to me, I want something a bit bolder but not to strong any suggestions? oh by the way the new revision i did I used Univers. Let me know your thoughts.

Peace.  
Elias Tercero

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sbs\_new.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045929/http:/typophile.com/files/sbs_new.jpg) | 40.07 KB |
author: sightbox.la

comments.content:
Man!! tough crowd. Can someone throw me a bone over here?  
Elias Tercero!

Overall, it seems a little too safe for a design studio, IMO.  
Have you looked at more bold fonts like [kenteken](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045929/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=kenteken&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=SIGHTBOX&nb_ppp=10&psize=l&classt=alpha) or [downtempo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045929/http:/sudtipos.com/fonts/21)?
FWIW I think the mark (box + 4 corners) feels .. err .. heavy and fit more for a construction business or a block supply store rather than a design studio.

Yeah, that logo+type is really... square.  
What about a square-shaped iris?

As for the type, I'm getting this vibe for squat, thin letterforms.

hhp
